intro: Galium trachycaypum, commonly known as rough-stemmed bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds. Galium trachycaypum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
